text.p: Computron Software Inc said on Thursday that it restated its consolidated financial statements for 1992 through 1995, reflecting losses higher than previously reported.

For the year ended December 31, 1992, Computron restated its net loss to $3,347,000 and total revenues to $19,645,000. Previously, it reported a net loss of $2,479,000 and total revenues of $20,513,000.
For the year ended December 31, 1993, the company restated its loss to $3,864,000 and total revenues to $23,588,000.
It previously reported a net loss of $3,170,000 and total revenues of $24,282,000.

For the year ended December 31, 1994, Computron restated results to a net loss of $2,408,000 or a loss of $0.13 per and total revenues of $32,473,000. Previously, it reported a profit of $77,000 or nil earnings per share and total revenues of $34,958,000.
For the year ended December 31, 1995, the company reported a restated net loss of $8,578,000 or $0.46 per and total revenues of $52,795,000.
It previously reported a net loss of $7,312,000 or a loss of $0.39 per share and total revenues of $55,519,000.

For the nine-month period ended September 30, 1996, the company restated its net loss to $23,214,000 or a loss of $1.12 and total revenues of $36,677,000. Previously, it reported a net loss of $21,333,000 or $1.03 and total revenues of $36,846,000.

Computron, based in Rutherford, New Jersey, designs, markets and supports N-tier Internet-enabled client/server-based financial, workflow, COOL and maintenance and materials/work management software solutions.
